data.title: Android - Texture2D.cs line 357 assert triggered
data.body:
Loading a PNG file on an Android device with latest MG3D code, getting "OpenTK.Graphics.ES20.All.InvalidEnum" in SetData<T> and thusly gettting the assert at said line which results in the flashy-screen and no drawing of sprite.

This is just a PNG file. I have not tried to load it as an XNB file yet.

here is the entire call stack:

Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.<int> at X:\GitHub\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\Texture2D.cs:360

data.title: Duplicate code in ContentManager.cs
.spritefont file not loaded
iOS - Content reader broken on device
data.body:
I am workin on porting my game from WP7 to iOS using the latest version from the develop3d branch. I have encountered an issue regarding my custom content readers. I have a fairly complicated content type, called Map which includes all the information for a level of the game (textures, rectangles, positions, timespans, etc). Everything loads fine in the simulator, but on an actual device (an iPad 2), I receive the following exception when a map is loading:

```
System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.Exception: Attempting to JIT compile method 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.NullableReader`1<Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle>:.ctor ()' while running with --aot-only.

  at System.Reflection.MonoCMethod.Invoke (System.Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x00109] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/mono/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/MonoMethod.cs:536
  --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
  at System.Reflection.MonoCMethod.Invoke (System.Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x0011f] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/mono/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/MonoMethod.cs:542
  at System.Reflection.MonoCMethod.Invoke (BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x00000] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/mono/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/MonoMethod.cs:551
  at System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo.Invoke (System.Object[] parameters) [0x0000e] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/mono/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/ConstructorInfo.cs:62
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentTypeReaderManager.LoadAssetReaders () [0x0011f] in /Users/turtlegames/Documents/Development/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Content/ContentTypeReaderManager.cs:131
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.InitializeTypeReaders () [0x0000c] in /Users/turtlegames/Documents/Development/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Content/ContentReader.cs:111
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.ReadAsset[Map] () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.ReadAsset[Map] (System.String assetName, System.Action`1 recordDisposableObject) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.Load[Map] (System.String assetName) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at TurtleGames.RumRun.GameScreen.MapForm.Load (TurtleGames.RumRun.SaveSystem.Box box) [0x00047] in /Users/turtlegames/Documents/Development/MonoDevelop/TurtleGames.RumRun/TurtleGames.RumRun/Screens/GameScreen/MapForm/MapForm.cs:100
[...]
```

It fails to invoke the ctor for the following type reader:
`Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.NullableReader`1[[Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle, Microsoft.Xna.Framework, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=842cf8be1de50553]]`

All my other custom type readers seem to be working, except for the Map.

I appreciate any help you can give me, regarding this issue :)

data.title: VideoSoundtrackType missing in develop3d
data.body:
Content.Pipeline.VideoContent:

```
    [ContentSerializerAttribute]
    public VideoSoundtrackType VideoSoundtrackType { get; set; }
```

"VideoSoundtrackType" is not a known type. Looks like it is missing or this type reference is misnamed.

Pulled the latest develop3d as of tonight at 9:53PM pacific.

data.title: Could not load type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.PrimitiveType'
data.body:
I am simply trying to draw a texture using a SpriteBatch, but am getting the following exception.  Any ideas what's going on or how to fix it?  I get this both when using the develop and develop3d branch DLL files.

data.title: MonoGame does not implement predefined DepthStencilStates?
data.body:
MonoGame doesn't seem to recognize any of the built-in XNA 4.0 DepthStencilStates.  When I try and set a DepthStencilState to DepthStencilState.DepthRead, I get the following exception:

DPSF.Exceptions.DPSFException: 
08-22 10:05:42.550 I/MonoDroid( 1167): UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: DPSF.Exceptions.DPSFException: A problem occurred while Initializing the Particle System. Inner DPSFException: System.MissingFieldException: Field 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.DepthStencilState.DepthRead' not found.
08-22 10:05:42.550 I/MonoDroid( 1167):   at DPSF.RenderProperties..ctor () [0x00008] in C:\dev\Git\DPSFProject\XNA 4.0\DPSF\DPSF\DPSF.cs:143

08-22 10:05:42.550 I/MonoDroid( 1167):   at DPSF.DPSF`2[VXNAWP7Engine.VParticleSystem.Particle,DPSF.DefaultSpriteParticleVertex].Initia08-22 10:05:42.550 I/MonoDroid( 1167):   at DPSF.RenderProperties..ctor () [0x00008] in C:\dev\Git\DPSFProject\XNA 4.0\DPSF\DPSF\DPSF.cs:143

08-22 10:05:42.550 I/MonoDroid( 1167): at VXNAWP7Engine.VParticleSystem.ParticleEngineUnder.LoadContent () [0x00017] in C:\Users\Dan Schroeder\Desktop\Nova\ClientWP7\VXNAWP7Engine\VParticleSystem\Engine.cs:33

08-22 10:05:42.550 I/MonoDroid( 1167): at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Initialize () [0x00038] in C:\Users\Dan Schroeder\Desktop\Nova\mono-

And when trying to use DepthStencilState.Default I get:

DPSF.Exceptions.DPSFException: 
08-22 10:15:13.350 I/MonoDroid( 1475): UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: DPSF.Exceptions.DPSFException: A problem occurred while Initializing the Particle System. Inner DPSFException: System.MissingFieldException: Field 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.DepthStencilState.Default' not found.

I get this error when using both the develop and develop3d MonoGame branches.  Am I doing something wrong? Or is this just not implemented in MonoGame yet? and if so, are there plans to add it? soon?

Thanks,
Dan

data.title: Content build pipeline audio classes
data.body: Most of the public Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio classes and enums.

data.title: Added more content build pipeline classes and enums
data.body:
- CompiledEffectContent
- EffectProcessor
- EffectProcessorDebugMode
- MaterialProcessor
- MaterialProcessorDefaultEffect
- TextureProcessorOutputFormat (broken out from TextureProcessor.cs)

data.title: Game.MouseVisible = true doesn't work on MacOS
data.body: Setting Game.MouseVisible to false hides the cursor like it should, but setting it back to true doesn't restore it. (Running latest develop3d)

data.title: Fix Y inversion in  GraphicsDevice.Viewport setter for OpenGL
data.body:
The Y axis is inverted when setting the viewport on OpenGL platforms because the params differ from the DirectX calls. The Y-inversion is already done on the ScissorRectangle but was missing from the Viewport setter. (This should fix #636 too)

As a side note, I still encounter many issues with window resizing:
- initial size ignored on Linux
- maximizing the window not properly updating viewports
- no ability to set a minimum window size like with Windows.Forms
- when releasing the mouse button after resizing the window on Windows, it only increases the window's bounds by a few pixels (this one appeared only recently)

I guess most games don't use resizable windows so this goes unnoticed most of the time. I'll try to fix as much as I can when I get around to it.

data.title: Contentpipelinefixes
data.body: Fixes to the content pipeline.

data.title: develop3d- Added more classes for content pipeline
data.body:
Primarily in the Graphics namespace.

Also merged as much as possible of Ray Batts' changes.  Some file references had to be temporarily removed from the csproj as the source files are not yet in source control.  Some source files that do exist also had to be temporarily removed as they depend on those files that don't exist.  Some source files have also been moved back to their original location.  If all source files could correctly named and be located in the directories matching their namespace it would be a lot easier to work with.

data.title: fixes for  #681 #683
data.body:
- Added ALT+F4 Support to close the Game on windows and Linux. #681
  Added Code to return the fullPath for the Content in case the developer uses Directory.SetCurrentDirectory( "C:\SomeFolder" ); during content loading. This is only for WINDOWS/LINUX and MAC as Im not sure how the Directory.SetCurrentDirectory works on mobile and windows 8 #683
  fixed a problem with the Linux project file

data.title: SpriteFontContent missing from develop3d?
data.body: Latest develop3d branch has referenced to SpriteFontContent in the content pipeline classes, but this class does not exist in the project anymore. Similarly TextureContent is missing.

data.title: Develop3d
data.body: Stuffs that I needed to fix in order to port my existing XNA project. Still not fully functional, but I feel that those fixes might be worth a look.

data.title: Wrong namespace for BlendFunction (XNA compatibility)
data.body: Just found that while making my wrapper ;)

data.title: Fixed Issue #568
data.body: Fixes issue https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/568

data.title: Merging Mouse Implementations
data.body:
Big unification of the 5 different implementations of Mouse.cs.

The functionality should be the same except we handle fake mouse events from touch in a unified way now.

Has been tested on WinRT, iOS, and Windows.

data.title: Fixing Bad Merge
data.body:
This fixes a few messed up elements from pull request....

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/686

Bad on my part for not looking at it closer before merging it.

Bad on GIT in that the default behavior when someone forgets to do 'git submodule update' is for it to look like a user change which often gets merged back into master.

data.title: Improvements to the content pipeline
data.body: It doesn't fully work yet, but a lot of functionality and/or stubbed out classes have been added.

data.title: Touches are disabled after screen orientation change
data.body:
AndroidGameWindow.cs line 440:
  _touchManager.Enabled = false;

If the app starts in landscape but programmatically changes to portrait, then touches are disabled and the surface change callback never enables the touches.
1. Start your game in landscape orientation
2. During the game init set the orientation to portrait
3. Touch screen - nada

data.title: Updated Libs Submodule
data.body: Updated the Libs submodule to reference the new head.

data.title: Content.Load<> fails if the current directory has changed
data.body:
XNA seems to handle loading assets properly from the content directory even if the current directory has changed after the game has started. MonoGame fails to find asset files.

```
Content.Load<Texture2D>( "SomeTexture" ); // Works with XNA & MonoGame
Directory.SetCurrentDirectory( "C:\\SomeFolder" );
Content.Load<Texture2D>( "SomeOtherTexture" ); // Works with XNA, fails with MonoGame
```

data.title: Develop3d - support MonoDevAssist VS Plugin for building iOS on Windows, plus minor fixes
data.body:
MonoDevAssist is a truly awesome tool (based on VSMonoTouch with lots of improvements). When you open iOS projects on Windows, it puts a line in the csproj files for the Monotouch targets. Since this change has no adverse effects, I'd like to include it in MonoGame (for convenience of myself and anyone else who uses MonoDevAssist).

The change to OpenALSupport.cs is required because the compiler in Windows is seems to be stricter than the Mono compiler about setting all "out" parameters before returning from a method.

The change to the Windows csproj is required since OpenTK.dll was updated to v1.1.

data.title: MonoGame desktop games can't be closed with Alt+F4
data.body: XNA Windows games can be closed with Alt+F4. Somehow OpenTK-based MonoGame games can't. I think it's worth fixing if at all possible.

data.title: Fixed crash bug for GraphicsDevice.SetVertexBuffer(null) in Windows 8.
data.body:
Added some BlendWeights and BlendIndices support to VertexElement.cs for Windows 8.
Added x86, x64 and ARM platform configurations to Windows 8 project.  Xbox LIVE for Windows 8 can not use Any CPU.
Fixed several long-standing compiler warnings.
